author: kevaundray
content: <@159152274659082240> you note that `compute_proof_from_blobs` takes 25ms for geth. Can you specify how many blobs are in this proof and whether the blobs are all of size 4096?

author: inphi
content: Yeah each blob are all 4096s, as they have to be. It takes that look to compute 2 blobs; was going for the worst case of 2 blobs per transaction ( `MAX_BLOBS_PER_TX` ). For a single blob, it's about 18ms (not sure why the nonlinearity)

author: kevaundray
content: Does this include committing to the blobs?

author: inphi
content: yup, it does.

author: kevaundray
content: Do you remember the specs you were using and is it possible to see the code?

author: inphi
content:
here's the spec - https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/eip4844/validator.md#compute_proof_from_blobs.
Geth's implementation - https://github.com/mdehoog/go-ethereum/blob/eip-4844/core/types/data_blob.go#L354

author: kevaundray
content: Thank you, how did you know that you needed to use sha256 in `sszHash` ?

author: bridge-bot
content: <xrchz> the executable specs use sha256 i think, but it may be hidden away in remerkleable

author: kevaundray
content: In the specs, it just says `hash(ssz_serialize(x))`  , does `hash` need to be defined?

author: inphi
content: Ah, the eip is out of date here. I think <@862973562243252234> may have a PR to update it though. The `sszHash` is what we use to implement `hash_to_bls_field` in the consensus-specs (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/eip4844/validator.md#hash_to_bls_field). We changed the hashing from root to a simple sha256 for performance reasons.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> yeah the EIP is indeed out of date

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> this is where i'm attempting to bring it up to date: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5649

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> but there are dark forces scheming against the unification

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> seems like pr5649 just got merged. eip and consensussspecs parity!

author: kevaundray
content:
<@159152274659082240> 

I get ~28ms on 2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9 so the numbers are at least consistent.

The impl I used is here: https://github.com/crate-crypto/proto-danksharding-crypto

The breakdown is roughly 43% to compute the two commitments (12ms) and 57% to compute the proof (16ms).  I have not checked that hard for optimisation strategies though so there might be something there

author: roberto.bayardo
content: Following up on <@427491045308235776>'s question, is "hash()" from the 4844 CL spec always understood to be sha256?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> yes

author: bridge-bot
content: <dcbuild3r> https://twitter.com/DCbuild3r/status/1577015638840647680?s=20&t=-TFu2ksx1wJRLwQ8VsfxOg

author: bridge-bot
content: <dcbuild3r> I'm also working on mapping out eip4844 contributors and all teams that need to integrate it so that we have a better overview of the EIP progress status

author: bridge-bot
content:
<timbeiko> FYI, I shared this last week: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room/4844-readiness-checklist.md

To avoid duplication, it'd probably be best to open a PR against that - it already links all the current implementations, open issues (though perhaps not all!) and folks working on them.

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Re: Worldcoin contributing, one obvious spot is perhaps another client implementation to interop with Geth/Prysm. Lighthouse had a prototype started, but it's unclear whether it will keep being worked on post EthBerlin

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Testing is also a big chunk of it, and there's work happening on c-kzg. IDK if they need more contributors there, though!

author: bridge-bot
content:
<timbeiko> Re: testing, one thing we discussed on the community call was to run this experiment: https://notes.ethereum.org/lQ_75o64R9q8ddt3M9M3tg?edit

Terence said Prysm could look into it, and has the monitoring infra already, but having more teams monitor, esp. with different client combos, would be very valuable. Especially with gas prices being low now üòä

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> Also, if anyone here feels the checklist misses something we should be looking into, please open a PR as well üòÅ! You don't need to "propose a solution", and it's valuable to track all the potential issues in one place.
